byline.contributor: Wai Moe reported from Naypyidaw, and Richard C. Paddock from Bangkok.
byline.original: By WAI MOE and RICHARD C. PADDOCK

abstract: Myanmar’s governing National League for Democracy moves to solidify Daw Aung San Suu Kyi's position as country's de facto leader; sidesteps Constitutional restriction which prohibits her serving as president by proposing creation of new state counselor position to oversee Parliament and executive office.
lead_paragraph: Her party, which won elections last fall, introduced a bill in Parliament to create the position of “state counselor,” which some compare to prime minister.

headline.main: Myanmar to Create New Post for Aung San Suu Kyi, Cementing Her Power
headline.print_headline: Myanmar Shifting Power to Democracy Leader

snippet: Her party, which won elections last fall, introduced a bill in Parliament to create the position of “state counselor,” which some compare to prime minister.
